CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material mentioned several times in the paragraph. It is a polymer and the acronym stands for the specific chemical structure of the material.
2. PC71BM: This is another material mentioned in the paragraph. It is also a polymer and the acronym stands for the specific chemical structure of the material.
3. DCB: This is a processing solvent used to spin-cast the PSFDTBT and P1 films.
4. ODCB: This is another processing solvent used to spin-coat the PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend film.
5. P1: This is another material mentioned in the paragraph, but no specific name or acronym is given. It is mentioned only as a comparison to the PSFDTBT material.
6. SiO2: This is not a material name, but rather the name of the gate dielectric layer used in the fabrication of the organic thin film field-effect transistors (OFETs).
7. ITO: This is not a material name, but rather an abbreviation for Indium Tin Oxide, which is a transparent conducting material used as the electrode in the fabrication of the organic thin film field-effect transistors (OFETs) and polymer solar cells.
8. PEDOT:PSS: This is a conducting polymer used as the hole transport layer in the fabrication of the organic thin film field-effect transistors (OFETs) and polymer solar cells.
9. LiF: This is a material used as the electron transport layer in the fabrication of the polymer solar cells.
10. Al: This is a material used as the back contact electrode in the fabrication of the polymer solar cells.
11. AM1.5G: This is a standard solar spectrum used for testing the photovoltaic performance of the polymer solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. DCB
4. ODCB
5. P1 (if considered a material)

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| DCB |
| ODCB |
| P1 (if considered a material) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

1. LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT: E_LUMO_PSFDTBT
2. LUMO energy level of PC71BM: E_LUMO_PC71BM
3. Optical energy gap (energy loss): E_g
4. Channel width: W
5. Channel length: L
6. Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer: C_i
7. Threshold voltage: V_T
8. Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film: μ_hole_PSFDTBT
9. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film: μ_hole_PSFDTBT_PC71BM
10. Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film: μ_e_PSFDTBT_PC71BM
11. Source-drain current: I_SD
12. Output characteristics: a
13. Transfer characteristics: b
14. Hole mobility of pure P1 film: μ_hole_P1
15. Weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM: -
16. Processing solvent: DCB, ODCB
17. Photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT: -
18. Device configuration: ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al
19. J-V curves: Figure 3a
20. Power conversion efficiency (PCE): -
21. Weight ratio: -
22. Results: Table 1.

Note: Some properties are mentioned in the context of a group or a range, so I marked them with a '-' sign, indicating that they are not specific properties of a single material.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT: E_LUMO_PSFDTBT
2. LUMO energy level of PC71BM: E_LUMO_PC71BM
3. Optical energy gap (energy loss): E_g
4. Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film: μ_hole_PSFDTBT
5. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film: μ_hole_PSFDTBT_PC71BM
6. Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film: μ_e_PSFDTBT_PC71BM
7. Power conversion efficiency (PCE): -

These are the properties that clearly refer to materials in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT (E_LUMO_PSFDTBT) |
| LUMO energy level of PC71BM (E_LUMO_PC71BM) |
| Optical energy gap (energy loss) |
| Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film (μ_hole_PSFDTBT) |
| Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film (μ_hole_PSFDTBT_PC71BM) |
| Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film (μ_e_PSFDTBT_PC71BM) |
| Power conversion efficiency (PCE) |

These are the properties that can be precisely extracted from the paragraph as material properties. The optical energy gap is mentioned but not explicitly stated as a property of a material, so it is not included in the table.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Let's think step by step.

1. Material property: LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT = -3.43 eV
2. Material property: LUMO energy level of PC71BM = 4.2 eV
3. Material property: Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film = 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1

5. Material property: Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film = 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
6. Material property: Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film = 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
7. Material property: Capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer (SiO2) = 7.5 nF / cm^2
8. Material property: Threshold voltage (V T) is not explicitly stated in the text.
9. Material property: Hole mobility of pure P1 film = 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
10. Material property: Weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM in PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film = 1 : 3
11. Material property: Processing solvent for PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film = ODCB
12. Photovoltaic performance: PCEs of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend solar cells = 4.1%
